<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Milling, as described in Section 17 of
this report, is conducted by conventional crushing, grinding and froth
flotation. Tails are impounded behind a dam located 750m south of the mill. </P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>In the author&#146;s opinion, there is
significant potential for discovery of additional Mineral Resources through
exploration and development along existing veins systems. In addition, there is
potential for discovery of other veins in the district, as there are drill
intercepts, with significant grades, that have not been correlated with known
structures. Total production by GPR at Topia is summarized below in Table 16-2.
</P>

<!--$$/page=--><A name=page_95></A><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD align=left rowSpan=4>
    <img
src="exhibit99-1x2x1.jpg" border=0 width="147" height="84"><BR><BR><BR></TD>
    <TD align=right width="50%" rowSpan=4>Great Panther Silver Limited
      <BR>NI43- 101 Report on the Topia Mine <BR>Mineral Resource Estimation
      <BR>Durango, Mexico </TD></TR>
</TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>17.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>RECOVERY METHODS</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The process flow sheet for the Topia
plant is illustrated in Figure 17-1. Coarse ore is placed in one of six bins,
which provides a means for segregation of ore types for batch processing, or
blending. Ore is passed through a grizzly to a 15&#148; x 24&#148; jaw crusher 
and then
over a 6&#146; x 12&#146; vibratory screen. Oversize (&gt;3/4 in) from the 
screen is sent
to a secondary cone crusher, and then conveyed to a 200t-capacity fine ore bin.
</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Segregation of sulphide particles is
achieved by means of a grinding circuit comprising three ball mills and two
10&#148;-dia. cyclones. Fine ore is fed to one of either a 6&#146; x 14&#146; or
5&#146; x 10&#146; ball
mill. When the larger unit is in use, the product is passed through the
cyclones, with the oversize fed back into the ball mill. If the smaller mill is
used, the oversize from the cyclones goes to a 4&#146; x 8&#146; ball mill which
operates
in closed circuit with the cyclones. Final grind size is 65% passing 
74&#956;.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The ore stream passes to a lead
flotation circuit comprising primary and secondary rougher and cleaner flotation
cells, followed by a similarly configured zinc circuit. Concentrates are dried
to 10% moisture content by means of disc filters and shipped via trucks to the
port of Manzanillo for sale to a concentrate buyer. Tails are piped to an
impoundment facility located downhill, approximately 750m from the mill.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>At the time of the site visit, GPR was
in the process of upgrading the flotation circuits to provide additional
capacity, and adding an additional decant tower to improve reclamation of water
from the tails.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The performance of the mill
demonstrates that the gold, silver, lead and zinc in the ores at Topia can be
recovered with conventional processes.</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>18.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>PROJECT INFRASTRUCTURE</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The Topia Mine is 235km northwest of,
and connected by gravel and paved road to, the logistical center of Durango,
Durango State. The trip from Topia to Durango takes approximately 8 hours to
drive by pickup truck. All minor supplies (fuel, food) can be purchased in
Topia, but equipment parts and major repair have to be secured through the
Durango facilities of the Company. The access road is sufficient for 30 tonne
articulated concentrate trucks. Topia has a runway sufficient for small single
or twin engine aircraft which is used regularly by Company personnel to access
either cities of Durango or Culiacan (in Sinaloa state). Topia Mine
infrastructure is shown on Figure 18-1. </P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The surface and underground
infrastructure at the Property includes the following: </P>

style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "

<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>19.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>MARKET STUDIES AND
CONTRACTS</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>19.1</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>Market Studies</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The principal commodities at the Topia
Mine are lead and zinc concentrates containing gold and silver. These products
are freely traded, at prices that are widely known, so that prospects for sale
of any production are virtually assured. There are smelters in Mexico that can
accept these concentrates, as well as other smelters around the world, and
traders who purchase such concentrates.</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>19.2</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>Contracts</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The Topia Mine is an operating mine
using both employees and contracted services under the direction of company
employed management. Administration, management, and a good deal of the mining
are carried out by GPR employees. There are a number of contracts in place for:
</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"  >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>The supply of labour and services in the El Rosario,
      Durangueno, Recompensa, El Ochenta, Hormiguera, and San Miguel mines
      through five contractors. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" >

      two contractors, and geological services through one contractor.

<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>20.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES, PERMITTING, AND SOCIAL OR
      COMMUNITY IMPACT</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Great Panther Silver Limited holds all
necessary environmental and mine permits to conduct planned exploration,
development, and mining operations at the Topia Mine.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>In July 2006, Great Panther received
its Single Environmental License LAU10/019-2006 (<I>Licencia Ambiental
Unica</I>), which is a direct regulatory instrument for industrial facilities
under federal jurisdiction in the prevention and control of pollution of the
atmosphere, and sets conditions for integral operation in accordance with
current environmental legislation. This permit was issued by SEMARNAT
(<I>Secretaria de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales</I>), the Secretary of
Environment and Natural Resources, and remains in effect. </P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Additionally, once a year and in
compliance with SEMARNAT&#146;s legislation, Great Panther submits the Annual
Operation Certificate <I>(Cedula de Operacion Anual),</I> which is the
instrument of data collection and reporting on emissions and transfers of
pollutants to air, water, and soil and management of hazardous materials.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The tailings storage facility is
operated in accordance with federal laws and Topia Mine staff works closely with
PROFEPA (<I>Procuraduria Federal de Proteccion al Ambiente</I>), the Federal
office for environmental protection. Topia Mine personnel carry out regular
monitoring and reclamation work on the site.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>In addition, all exploration activities
are in compliance with NOM-120-SEMARNAT-2011, which establishes the
specifications of environmental protection for mining exploration
activities.</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>20.1</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>Social or Community Impact</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Topia&#146;s community relations 
program
reinforces the Company&#146;s commitment to environmental, social and economic
sustainable development. These efforts aim to improve the quality of life in the
communities adjacent to the mine through environmental, social, health and
safety, and education programs.</P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The Company is the main employer in
this small community of almost 3,500 people and currently generates 336 direct
jobs for Mexican workers at its Topia Mine. Approximately 75% of its workforce
is from the neighboring communities of Topia, La Ojeda and Molinos.</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left
  width="50%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
<TD align=left>May 2014 </TD>
    <TD align=left width="50%">Page 20-1 </TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" align=center width="100%" color=black
noShade SIZE=5>
<!--$$/page=--><A name=page_101></A><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD align=left rowSpan=4>
    <img
src="exhibit99-1x2x1.jpg" border=0 width="147" height="84"><BR><BR><BR></TD>
    <TD align=right width="50%" rowSpan=4>Great Panther Silver Limited
      <BR>NI43- 101 Report on the Topia Mine <BR>Mineral Resource Estimation
      <BR>Durango, Mexico </TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Community support activities
include:</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Regular contributions of supplies to the Topia Clinic,
      the only health centre for the entire community. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify></P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%"></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Contributions for transportation to local sports teams to
      allow participation in Durango State competitions. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify></P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%"></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Support to local schools for infrastructure repairs,
      electronic equipment, and training and workshops focused on environmental
      care, sustainable use, conservation and preservation of natural resources.
      </P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Support for communities&#146; events and traditions 
through
      donations to local church, schools and other non- profit agencies.
  </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify></P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%"></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD align=left>
<P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Support to Topia municipality to complete road repairs
      and community garbage storage facility rehabilitation.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>There are always opportunities to
improve and promote open dialogue with all stakeholders. Great Panther will
continue working to minimize environmental impact and maximize social and
economic benefits in the communities in which it operates. </P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>20.2</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>Reclamation Closure</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The cost for closure, adjusted for
inflation, is estimated to be approximately MXP $21.5 million. The Company has
recorded approximately CAD $1.1 million (discounted) as its asset retirement
obligation in its financial statements as at June 30, 2015.</P>

<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>21.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>CAPITAL AND OPERATING
COSTS</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Capital and operating budgets are
prepared each year for the GMC by mine staff. These budgets are continuously
reviewed against production to ensure profitability. For the 2014
(January-December) operating year the average cost of production was US$186 per
tonne (Table 21-1), which included plant, administration and mining costs.</P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"  >&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align=left ><B>Table 21-1:</B> </TD>
    <TD align=left width="85%"><B>2014 (January through December) Cost Report
      for Topia Mine</B> </TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<DIV align=left>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="50%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%"  >&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" noWrap align=left><B>Plant</B>
    </TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" noWrap align=left
      width="50%">US$36 per tonne </TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%" >&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align=left><B>Administration</B> </TD>
    <TD align=left width="50%">US$33 per tonne </TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%" >&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align=left><B>Mining</B> </TD>
    <TD align=left width="50%">US$117 per tonne </TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%" >&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" align=left><B>Total Unit
      costs</B> </TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1px solid" align=left width="50%">US$186
      per tonne </TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The Topia Mine is operated with
contractors under the supervision of GPR management personnel. The contractors
and management personnel are engaged by service companies that provide their
services to the underlying owner of the mineral properties. At the end of Q4
2014, there were 162 employees (including 30 administrative and management
personnel) and 174 contractors at the site.</P>

<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>23.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>ADJACENT PROPERTIES</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The Topia Mine property is within the
Topia Mine District which encompasses Topia and San Bernabe, a NE to ENE
trending multiple vein set. </P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Presently the only continually
operating mill is on the GPR property although several other small mills
(&lt;50tpd) do some custom tolling. Various other claims in the district are
mined intermittently.</P>

style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "

<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify><B>Notes: </B></P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>1. CIM Definitions were followed for
Mineral Resources. <br>
2. Measured and Indicated Mineral
Resources are reported at a cut-off Net Smelter Return (NSR) of US$180/t. <br>
3. Area-Specific Bulk Densities as
  follows: Argentina - 3.06t/m <SUP>3</SUP>; Don Benito - 3.26t/m <SUP>3</SUP>;
  Durangueno - 3.12t/m <SUP>3</SUP>; El Rosario - 3.00t/m <SUP>3</SUP>; 
Hormiguera
  - 2.56t/m <SUP>3</SUP>; La Prieta - 2.85t/m <SUP>3</SUP>; Recompensa - 3.30t/m
<SUP>3</SUP>. <br>
4. NSR cut-offs in US$ include 1522
  Mine $167/t, Argentina Mine $197/t, Durangueno Mine $153/t, Recompensa Mine
  $196/t, Hormiguera Mine $189/t, El Rosario Mine $173/t, and La Prieta 
$204/t.<br>
  5. Totals may not agree due to
rounding. <br>
6. A minimum mining width of 0.30
metres was used. <br>
7. Mineral Resources are estimated
  using metal prices of: US$1,200/oz Au, US$17.00/oz Ag, US$0.90/lb Pb, and
US$0.95/lb Zn. </P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>It is concluded that: </P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>The sampling is appropriate for the
deposit type and mineralization style. Reasonable and practical steps are taken
to ensure security of the samples. Diamond drilling, logging, and core handling
are being carried out in a reasonable fashion, consistent with industry best
practice. </P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"  >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Assaying is being conducted using conventional methods
      consistent with common industry practice. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify> </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%"></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>The most recent independent audit of the laboratory
      conducted in January 2013 (Johnson, 2013) reported acceptable practices.
      Concern was expressed however, regarding the original-duplicate assay
      result comparisons which appeared to show better correlation than
      expected. An improvement in fire assay methodology was noted as compared
      with previous audits. </P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left
  width="50%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TABLE

<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD align=left rowSpan=4>
    <img

    <TD align=right width="50%" rowSpan=4>Great Panther Silver Limited
      <BR>NI43- 101 Report on the Topia Mine <BR>Mineral Resource Estimation
      <BR>Durango, Mexico </TD></TR>
</TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"  ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Check sampling of the Topia Lab at the Company&#146;s
      Guanajuato Mine lab, independently run by SGS, shows good correlations of
      silver, gold, lead and zinc assays. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>The sample database contains several small
      low-consequence errors. Corrections were made to the assay data base, as
      it was noted that some zinc values were missing from Pe&#241;oles&#146; 
sample data
      from the Argentina Mine wireframes. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Revisions to the top cuts were based on reconciliation
      outcomes. Reconciliation initially compared actual material milled from
      each mine with estimated material mined from the block model (using a
      cookie cutter outline of material mined between the recent and past
      effective dates and cutting it out of the block model). Although this is
      quite crude it does give some guidance. Secondly the percent difference
      between the tonnes mined and tonnes estimated from the block model were
      compared with the percentage difference in the Ag, Au, Pb, and Zn values
      between the head grades and the block model estimated grades. If there was
      great variance in the percentage difference between the two data-sets, the
      top cut in the block model estimated grade was reviewed and modified to
      bring the variance between the two data-sets into alignment. 
</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" ></TD>
<TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Dilution is not used in the Mineral Resource Estimates,
      other than using a minimum mining width (or minimum wireframe width) of
      0.3m, and duly diluting the grade of all samples &lt;0.3m to 0.3m.
      Reconciliation gives a crude estimate of dilution by comparing the mined
      tonnes against the estimated tonnes from the block model, and this helps,
      along with known geological conditions and mining methods, with
      constraining the wireframe volumes. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>For Measured plus Indicated, there is a 75% increase in
      tonnes, a 29% increase in contained silver, 34% increase in contained
      gold, 28% increase in contained lead and 52% increase in contained zinc as
      compared with the previous year's estimate. For Inferred, increases of 71%
      in tonnes, 29% in contained silver, 9% in contained lead, and 49% in
      contained zinc, as well as an increase of 33% in contained gold were
      reported. All these increases in contained metal reflect increases in
      tonnes for 2014, despite lower overall grades. Factors affecting the
      change in the resource are suggested to be related to:
</P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%"  >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#8722; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="85%">
      <P align=justify>Revision and application of different assay caps;
  </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#8722; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="85%">
      <P align=justify>Changes to NSR calculation (including metal price
      changes) methodology which gave higher NSR values in the current
      Estimation than the previous Estimate; </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#8722; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="85%">
      <P align=justify>Expansion of existing zones in areas where new data
      collection has taken place; and </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="10%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left >
      <P align=justify>&#8722; </P></TD>
<TD align=left width="85%">
      <P align=justify>Depletion of some areas due to mining.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left
  width="50%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
<TD align=left>May 2014 </TD>
    <TD align=left width="50%">Page 25-2 </TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" align=center width="100%" color=black
noShade SIZE=5>

    <TD align=left rowSpan=4>
    <img
src="exhibit99-1x2x1.jpg" border=0 width="147" height="84"><BR><BR><BR></TD>
    <TD align=right width="50%" rowSpan=4>Great Panther Silver Limited
      <BR>NI43- 101 Report on the Topia Mine <BR>Mineral Resource Estimation
      <BR>Durango, Mexico </TD></TR>
</TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"  ></TD>
    <TD align=left >&#149; </TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">There is potential for the future addition of
      Mineral Resources at Topia through exploration and development.
  </TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

<!--$$/page=--><A name=page_109></A><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD align=left rowSpan=4>
    <img
src="exhibit99-1x2x1.jpg" border=0 width="147" height="84"><BR><BR><BR></TD>
    <TD align=right width="50%" rowSpan=4>Great Panther Silver Limited
      <BR>NI43- 101 Report on the Topia Mine <BR>Mineral Resource Estimation
<BR>Durango, Mexico </TD></TR>
</TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%"><B>26.0</B> </TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify><B>RECOMMENDATIONS</B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 5%" align=justify>Recommendations are that: </P>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%" ></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Routine independent laboratory audits should continue.
      GPR's own QA/QC monitoring should also continue to ensure that any
      identified issues are followed up as real-time as possible to prevent
      undetected long-term assaying problems. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Better validation measures should be taken to ensure the
      database is as error-free as possible. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify></P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%"></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Results below detection limit should not be stored as
      '0'. A suggested alternative is to store these as half the detection
      limit, or to use an acronym indicating below detection values. 
</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
<P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>A reasonable minimum sample width for the channels should
      be established and maintained</P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify></P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>. </P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=top>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD align=left>
      <P align=justify>&#149; </P></TD>
    <TD align=left width="90%">
      <P align=justify>Exploration and development should continue in order to
      continue to add to the resource base. GPR plans to continue with on -site
      geological work at Topia in 2015 . See Table 26-1 below for proposed
      budget details: </P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

<TABLE
style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1px solid" align=left

<P align=justify>I, Robert F. Brown, 3977 Westridge Ave., West Vancouver, B.C.,
Canada, as an the author of this report &#147;NI43-101 Report on the TOPIA Mine
Mineral Resource Estimates, as of NOVEMBER 30TH, 2014&#148; prepared for Great
Panther Silver Limited., dated July 6, 2015, do hereby certify that; </P>

style="BORDER-COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; "
cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0 BCLLIST>
<TR>
    <TD width="5%"  >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="5%">

Kingston,
      Ontario (1975) and hold a B. Sc. degree in Geology.</P></TD></TR>

      Panther Silver Limited.</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD width="5%">

      companies since graduation in 1975.</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >

    <TD width="5%">

      of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of B.C. since 
1982.</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="5%" >
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>
    <TD width="5%">
      <P align=justify>&nbsp;</P></TD>

    <TD width="5%" >

      <P align=justify>5. </P></TD>
    <TD>
      <P align=justify>I have read the definitions of &#147;Qualified 
Person&#148; set out
      in NI 43-101 and certify that by reason of my education, affiliation with
      a professional association and past relevant work experience, I fulfil the
      requirements to be a &#147;Qualified Person&#148; for the purposes of NI 
43-101. My
      relevant experience includes practice as a geologist in the fields of
      exploration,resource definition and estimation, and mining on projects at
      various stages of development (green-fields through to established
      operation) within Mexico, Canada, and USA. I have worked primarily with
      gold and silver deposits hosted within various geological environments in
      both open pit and underground operating environments.</P></TD></TR>

    <TD width="5%" >

<HTML>
<HEAD>
   <TITLE>Great Panther Silver Ltd.: Exhibit 99.3 - Filed by 
newsfilecorp.com</TITLE>
   <META name="HandheldFriendly" content="true">

<BODY style="font-size:10pt;">
<HR noshade align="center" width=100% size=3 color="black">
<!--$$/page=--><A name=page_1></A>
<P align=center><B>CONSENT OF QUALIFIED PERSON </B></P>
<P align=justify>August 18, 2015 </P>
<P align=justify>I, Robert F. Brown, P. Eng., do hereby consent to the public
filing of the report titled &#147;NI43-101 Report on the Topia Mine Mineral 
Resource
Estimates, as of November 30<SUP>th</SUP>, 2014&#148; (the &#147;Technical 
Report&#148;),
prepared for Great Panther Silver Limited., dated July 6, 2015, and extracts
from, or the summary of, the Technical Report in the press release of Great
Panther Silver Limited dated July 9, 2015 (the &#147;Press Release&#148;). </P>
<P align=justify>I also certify that I have read the Press Release and that it
fairly and accurately represents the information in the Technical Report that
supports the Press Release.</P>
